of Wildlife Damage

477.91.text: and those wings are simply made

480.55.text:

use fetid meat, you

510.18.text:

they carry the bacteria

524.56.text:

unless you wear good rubber

you know, if it's

they can't climb

- Well, he says he

651.15.text:

heat of the summer

653.62.text:
where there's no water
sources like that.

656.62.text:
Normally, they get
their water from worms,

660.59.text:
But exceedingly hot,
they go to ripe tomatoes

664.43.text:
and they'll peck it
to get the moisture.

667.43.text:
And my cure for that,
if that's the problem,

670.17.text:
is I don't let the tomatoes
get ripe on the vine.

673.71.text:
I always pick 'em up
where they're turning

678.88.text:
and I let them finish ripening
up on the kitchen counter.

682.48.text: But as far as worms go,

684.42.text:
I think you had mentioned
something about a worm.

686.32.text:
- Right, one of the
worms that came out to me

It actually eats the foliage
and it eats the fruit as well.

694.06.text:
You know, little green
worm, brown worm,

696.73.text:
it will actually bore
inside of the green tomato.

700.20.text:
And it pretty much
eats the insides

704.94.text: You know, for the most part.

707.01.text: And Bt will take care of that.

708.81.text: So, I would stop at using Bt.

716.75.text: is the brand name for Bt.

718.45.text:
Javelin is another
one, Thuracide is
another one as well.

721.42.text:
So, just use a Bt
product on that.

724.19.text:
It gives, of course, the
fruit worm a stomach ache,

728.46.text:
- I still have not figured
out how to pronounce the Bt.

731.10.text:
- (laughs) Haha, just

and my experience has

1135.80.text:
when you see that

that bloodgood, would
like some shade.

1148.91.text:
It would really do
better with some shade

1150.88.text:
because when this intense

with wind, which we had wind,
it has really desiccated

1157.92.text: those leaves and you'll get that

1159.69.text:
edge of the leaves curling up,

1163.50.text:
But I've had that tree
almost completely defoliate

1166.63.text:

person that I am, not even

1172.41.text:

with the wind blowing, be

And this is from Matt, and
this is actually a YouTube.

1218.08.text:
So this a YouTube
question from Matt,

1221.22.text:
So he wants to know if
you can spray fungicide

1222.72.text:
on your tomatoes while
the sun is shining.

1225.22.text:
- Well, one thing like
neem oil, which is,

1228.69.text:
in my case, the most
successful fungicide I've used,

1234.63.text:
usually you spray
that and if it's sunny

1239.11.text:
it will have a tendency
to burn the plant.

1241.27.text:
So it's recommended to spray
them early in the morning

1244.81.text:
so the plant will dry
before the sun comes up.

1248.35.text:
My preference is, I
spray it in the evening

1254.22.text:
before I go to bed, or the
sun's still up but setting,

1257.72.text: and I'll spray it at that time

1259.76.text:
that way I don't have to worry
about the sun bothering it.

1263.10.text:
Now about some of
the other fungicides,

1270.57.text:
Just like the neem oil,
if you have any doubts,

1273.44.text:
spray it in the evening,
and the foliage will be dry

1276.88.text: way before the sun comes up.

1279.15.text:
And that's my
recommendation for that.

1280.91.text:
- Spraying the foliage
for the most part

1282.65.text:
just want to make sure
that it does dry off.

1285.48.text:
- And normally too, when you
spray, you want to spray it

1287.52.text:
to the point where
it's dripping.

1290.62.text:
- And read the label
on that as well.

1292.46.text: Always read the label on that.

1318.18.text:
- They have the same
problem, yes we do.

1320.95.text:
Well, one thing she's
gotta understand

1323.99.text:
is that actually pears ripen
after they've been picked.

1327.79.text:
So you really need to
pick the pears and then

1329.80.text:
put them inside with,
sometimes people put them in

1333.17.text:
brown plastic bags
so that they'll all
be together in there.

1338.10.text:
Keep the gases that help
them ripen together.

1341.77.text:
Or they'll put them
with other fruit.

1343.74.text:
- Right, 'cause I actually
put ours with bananas.

1347.21.text:
Yeah, the ethylene
gas that releases

1351.68.text:
The thing about pears on
the tree that I've noticed

1354.39.text:
from mine, that I've
had for some years now,

1356.56.text:
they seem to ripen
from the inside out.

1359.79.text:
It does make it hard to kinda
figure out what's going on

1362.76.text:
most of the time, but
yeah, just pick them off

1365.83.text:
early enough then just put
them in a bowl full of bananas

1373.74.text:
Even though they look
ripe and they're still,

1375.57.text:
they're not what you call
an eating kind of pear.

1379.68.text:
Mine, I do better
with when I can them

1381.95.text:
or preserve them
or cook with them,

1384.62.text: and they're that kind of a pear.

1387.59.text:
Since she doesn't know
what her variety is

1389.32.text:
that might be the
same situation too

1391.79.text:
that they're a
little harder pear.

1394.39.text:
I mean, they're
still good to eat.

1396.23.text: But you know, they are crunchy.

1408.17.text:
- And I just so happen
to have what I think

1411.71.text:
may be the answer
to the question.

1413.81.text:
- We can probably
find it within a block

1415.15.text: any time we take a walk.

1416.85.text:
- Oh yes, and it was
found within a block
for the most part.

1420.02.text:
The black stuff you
see on the leaves,

1425.26.text:
The culprit here would be
the Cottony Camellia Scale.

1429.90.text:
It's a white scale, the
females have the over sacks.

1433.33.text:
And of course, underneath
those would be the eggs.

1436.90.text:
This is the time were
you see the crawlers.

1440.31.text:
They're soft scales, and of
course, they suck plant sap.

1444.31.text:
They excrete honeydew,
and on that honeydew

1446.88.text:
grows the fungus,
black sooty mold.

1450.08.text:
- I know people want to
diagnosis this as a disease.

1453.62.text:
You have to kinda explain
that scale is an insect

1455.82.text:
and that is the residue
once it suck the sap,

1459.12.text:
that the excrement provides a
substrate for that sooty mold.

1464.10.text:
So the remedy is to
get rid of the insect.

1466.30.text:
- You gotta get
rid of the scale.

1468.73.text:
Use oil, horticultural
oil would do the trick.

1472.67.text:
I don't like using
all the harsh stuff.

1475.61.text:
It would have been better if
you could use dormant oil,

1477.74.text:
early in the season,
but now you can use

1479.04.text:
the horticultural
oil, that'll be fine.

1481.81.text:
Get good coverage underneath
the leaves, think that works.
